posts._title: Peter Medak – A Day in the Death of Joe Egg (1972)
posts.title: A Day in the Death of Joe Egg
posts.excerpt: Synopsis:A couple uses extremely black comedy to survive taking care of a daughter who is nearly completely brain dead. They take turns doing the daughter’s voice and stare into the eyes of death and emotional trauma with a humor that hides their pain.

posts.title: Skuki radi
posts.excerpt: “”People living near a by-station, sincerely envied passengers of the passing trains. Arina, a homely lonely woman of about 40 was a cook at the station. Once the pointsman Gomozov dropped in to see her in the kitchen. The lonely man had recently lost his family and asked her to sew a couple of shirts …

posts._title: Andrzej Zulawski – Mes nuits sont plus belles que vos jours AKA My Nights Are More Beautiful Than Your Days (1989)
posts.title: Mes nuits sont plus belles que vos jours
posts.excerpt: Lucas has invented a new computer language but at the same time he has been informed about his strange terminal illness during which he has been gradually losing his memory. Shortly after that he meets Blanche who acts as a medium in a bizarre traveling show. Dying Lucas follows her to the sea resort where …
posts.titleEnglish: My Nights Are More Beautiful Than Your Days

posts.title: Totally Fed Up
posts.excerpt: Quote:Six queer teenagers struggle to get along with each other and with life in the face of varying obstacles. Fernando F. posts._title: Lilyan Sievernich – John Huston and the Dubliners (1988)
posts.title: John Huston and the Dubliners
posts.excerpt: John Huston and the Dubliners is a valentine to the late director and a relatively standard production film about his making of The Dead. Much time is devoted to the actors’ understandably admiring comments about Mr. Huston, and to the disposition of the prop department’s fake snow. The film has the potential to seem ordinary, …

posts._title: Peter Fleischmann – Das Unheil AKA Havoc AKA The Bells of Silesia (1972) (HD)
posts.title: Das Unheil
posts.excerpt: Quote:A small town in Germany in the early 70s. Hille, the son of the local preacher, tries for the second time to graduate high school. Despite sophisticated efforts at memorization, he knows he won’t succeed this time either. At the same time other, more ominous problems occur: a choir girl thinks he impregnated her. His …
posts.titleEnglish: Havoc AKA The Bells of Silesia (1972)

posts._title: Hideo Suzuki – Sono bashoni onna arite AKA Women of Design (1962)
posts.title: Sono bashoni onna arite
posts.excerpt: Two employees of rival ad agencies vie for the same contract, and each other’s hearts, in this restrained office drama from director Hideo Suzuki. Stars Yoko Tsukasa and Akira Takarada.

posts.title: Au hasard Balthazar (1966)
posts.excerpt: Quote:The story of a mistreated donkey and the people around him. A study on saintliness and a sister piece to Bresson’s Mouchette. Quote:In the French countryside near the Pyrenees, a baby donkey is adopted by young children – Jacques and his sisters, who live on a farm. They baptize the donkey (and christen it Balthazar) …

posts.title: Glória
posts.excerpt: Quote:Gloria is set against the backdrop of a rural landscape slowly disappearing in modern Portugal. The small border town of Vila de Santiago, once a booming trade center for illegal trafficking, is about to become a ghost town, as a new motorway is to bypass the city.

posts._title: Louis Malle – Ascenseur pour l’échafaud AKA Elevator to the Gallows (1958)
posts.title: Ascenseur pour l’échafaud
posts.excerpt: Quote:Malle’s first feature, a straightforward but classy thriller about an ex-paratrooper’s attempt to dispose of his mistress’ tycoon husband in a perfect murder. It became associated with the early excitements of the nouvelle vague mainly through the performances of Ronet (playing a prototype of the disgruntled Vietnam veteran) and Moreau (who does some moody solo …
